title: Projects
text:
Macroeconomics Group Presentation about the Diamond Dybvig model of Bank Runs (finished) : This is a group presentation done in the spring semester of 2024 for a Macroeconomics 2 class taught by Jean Barthélemy (Banque de France) that consisted in an article review of “Bank runs, Deposit Insurance, and Liquidity”, by Douglas W. Diamond and Philip H. Dybvig (2020). We received the grade of 19/20 for this presentation.
Microeconomics Group project about modelling class attendance in a Game Theoretical Framework (finished) : This is a group project done in the spring semester of 2024 for a Microeconomics 2 class taught by Emeric Henry (Sciences Po Paris) that consisted in the use of notions seen in class on a chosen case. We choose to do it on strategic interactions between students in a context of class attendance. We received the grade of 17.5/20 for this work.
Political Economy Theory Paper: “Who controls the flows? A comparative analysis of Fernand Braudel and David Harvey” (finished) : This is a theory paper done in the fall semester of 2022 for the POLECON 101 class (Contemporary Theory of Political Economy) taught by Steven K. Vogel (UC Berkeley) that consisted in connecting a reading from an author studied in lecture to an author from our personal references. This work received the grade of A+.

title: Contact
text: Feel free to contact me if you wish ! You can contact me via my academic mail adress : etienne.comperat, followed by “@sciencespo.fr”, you can also contact me per LinkedIn.

title: Etienne Compérat
text:
Hello, I am Etienne Compérat, currently a second year student of the Economic Research Master at Sciences Po Paris. I am willing to pursue in Economic research, hence the goal of this website is to allow me to present efficiently my work so far, skills and projects for the future.
I have a Bachelor degree in Political and Social Sciences from Sciences Po with the Economics major and a minor in Central and Eastern European Studies. I have also done an exchange year at the University of California on the Berkeley campus where I have followed the Environmental and Economics Policies major. My research interest are political economy, spatial economy and economic history.
Thank you Paulo for helping me realizing this website ! (You can find his Research Portfolio Tutorialhere.)
